snippet: Josmery Batista, who received a diagnosis of Stage 4 breast cancer last year, is so enfeebled by the effects of chemotherapy that sometimes she is unable to hold her infant son.
abstract: Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens, agency supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps breast cancer patient Josmery Batista pay for child care and food.
lead_paragraph: Josmery Batista, who received a diagnosis of Stage 4 breast cancer last year, is so enfeebled by the effects of chemotherapy that sometimes she is unable to hold her infant son.

headline.seo: Single Mother Battling Breast Cancer Takes Strength From Her Children
headline.main: Battling Breast Cancer, Single Mother Takes Strength From Her Children
headline.print_headline: Battling Breast Cancer, Single Mother Takes Strength From Her Children
